snippet: The attack killed at least 17 people and came just hours after the top United Nations envoy in Afghanistan said militants were willing to talk about lowering civilian deaths.
abstract: Taliban militants detonate bomb outside Supreme Court complex in Kabul, killing at least 17 civilians and wounding 39 others; explosion occurs within hours of top United Nations official in Afghanistan issuing statement saying Taliban had signaled their willingness to talk about reducing civilian casualties.

byline.contributor: Sangar Rahimi, Sharifullah Sahak and Habib Zahori contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The attack killed at least 17 people and came just hours after the top United Nations envoy in Afghanistan said militants were willing to talk about lowering civilian deaths.

headline.seo: Taliban Bomb Kills Court Workers in Kabul
headline.main: Taliban Bomb Attack Kills Court Workers in Kabul
headline.print_headline: Taliban Bomb Attack Kills Court Workers in Kabul
